description: [Status: stable] [Name: bad-file-permissions] [Message: os.chmod setting a permissive mask {mask:#o} on file or directory] What it does Checks for files with overly permissive permissions. Why is this bad? Overly permissive file permissions may allow unintended access and arbitrary code execution. Example import os os.chmod("/etc/secrets.txt", 0o666) # rw-rw-rw- Use instead: import os os.chmod("/etc/secrets.txt", 0o600) # rw-------
